Package com.leakyabstractions.result

Interface LazyConsumer<T>

Type Parameters:
T - the type of the input to the action
All Superinterfaces:
Consumer<T>
Functional Interface:
This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.
@FunctionalInterface
public interface LazyConsumer<T>
extends Consumer<T>
Represents an action to be lazily performed with the success/failure value of a result.

Unlike regular ones, lazy consumers won't force a lazy result to retrieve the backing result from its supplier. In other words, they may be ignored if the lazy result ends up not invoking its result supplier.

Instances of objects implementing this interface are intended to be passed as parameters to Result.ifSuccess(Consumer), Result.ifSuccessOrElse(Consumer, Consumer) and Result.ifFailure(Consumer) when the action only needs to be performed if the lazy result eventually retrieves an actual result from its supplier.

If a lazy consumer is passed to a non-lazy result, or to a lazy result that has already retrieved the backing result from its supplier, then the action will be executed immediately.

This is a functional interface whose functional method is Consumer.accept(Object).

Author:
Guillermo Calvo
See Also:
Results.lazy(Consumer)
